template:docs/components/editable-templa.title: Basic Arithmetic
template:docs/components/editable-templa.text: Basic Arithmetic Addition = Division = Modulus = Multiplication = Subtraction = Advanced Arithmetic GCD = Composable Examples Composable Subtraction = Composable Multiple Operations = Min, Max, Round Min = Max = Round = Random Numbers Integer (0 - 1) = Bounded Int (0 - 42) = Bounded Int (21 - 1797) = Float, 2 decimals (0 - 1) = Float, 4 decimals (0 - 1) = Bounded Float, 1 decimal (20 - 93) =

functions.name: abs
functions.description:
Uses Math.abs to take the absolute value of the number passed to the helper.

{{abs a}}

returns.description: The absolute value of the passed number

params.name: number
params.description: The number to take the absolute value of

functions.name: acos
functions.description:
Executes Math.acos on the number passed to the helper.

{{acos a}}

returns.description: The acos of the passed number

functions.name: acosh
functions.description:
Executes Math.acosh on the number passed to the helper.

{{acosh a}}

returns.description: The acosh of the passed number

functions.name: add
functions.description:
Sums two or more numbers

{{add a b}}

returns.description: The sum of all the passed numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to sum

functions.name: asin
functions.description:
Executes Math.asin on the number passed to the helper.

functions.name: atan
functions.description:

params.name: number1
params.description: The first number to pass to `Math.atan2`

params.name: number2
params.description: The second number to pass to `Math.atan2`

functions.name: atanh
functions.description:
Executes Math.atanh on the number passed to the helper.

{{atanh a}}

returns.description: The atanh of the passed number

Divides two or more numbers

params.description: A list of numbers to divide

functions.name: exp
functions.description:
Executes Math.exp on the number passed to the helper.

{{exp a}}

returns.description: The exp of the passed number

functions.description:
Executes Math.expm1 on the number passed to the helper.

returns.description: The floor of the passed number

functions.description:
Executes Math.fround on the number passed to the helper.

returns.description: The fround of the passed number

functions.name: gcd
functions.description:
Returns the greatest positive integer that divides each of two integers

{{gcd a b}}

returns.description: The GCD of the two numbers passed

functions.name: hypot
functions.description:
Takes two or more numbers, and returns the square root of the sum of squares of them using Math.hypot

{{max a b}}

returns.description: The hypot of the set of numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to pass to `Math.hypot`

functions.name: imul
functions.description:
Executes Math.imul on the number passed to the helper.

{{imul a}}

returns.description: The imul of the passed numbers

params.name: number1
params.description: The first number to pass to `Math.imul`

params.name: number2
params.description: The second number to pass to `Math.imul`

functions.name: lcm
functions.description:
Returns the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both number1 and number2

{{lcm a b}}

returns.description: The LCM of the two numbers passed

functions.name: logE
functions.description:
Executes Math.log on the number passed to the helper.

{{log-e a}}

returns.description: The log of the passed number

functions.name: log10
functions.description:
Executes Math.log10 on the number passed to the helper.

{{log10 a}}

returns.description: The log10 of the passed number

functions.name: log1p
functions.description:
Executes Math.log1p on the number passed to the helper.

{{log1p a}}

returns.description: The log1p of the passed number

functions.name: log2

Executes Math.log2 on the number passed to the helper.

{{log2 a}}

returns.description: The log2 of the passed number

functions.name: max
functions.description:
Takes two or more numbers, and finds the max of the set using Math.max

{{max a b}}

returns.description: The max of the set of numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to pass to `Math.max`

functions.name: min
functions.description:
Takes two or more numbers, and finds the min of the set using Math.min

{{min a b}}

returns.description: The min of the set of numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to pass to `Math.min`

functions.name: mod
functions.description:
Takes the modulus of two or more numbers

{{mod a b}}

returns.description: The modulus of all the passed numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to modulus

functions.name: mult
functions.description:
Multiplies two or more numbers

{{mult a b}}

returns.description: The product of all the passed numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to multiply

functions.name: pow
functions.description:
Takes two or more numbers, using the first as the base number, then using each subsequent number as an exponent to the previous value

{{pow a b}}

returns.description: The base raised to all exponents

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to pass to `Math.pow`

functions.name: random
functions.description:
Executes Math.random with the provided upper-bounded randoms, lower- and upper-bounded randoms, and the option to configure decimal precision.

{{random}} or {{random decimals=4}}
{{random 42}} or {{random 42 decimals=4}}
{{random 21 1797}} or {{random 21 1797 decimals=4}}

returns.description: The random generated number

functions.name: sign
functions.description:
Executes Math.sign on the number passed to the helper.

{{sign a}}

returns.description: The sign of the passed number

functions.name: sin
functions.description:
Executes Math.sin on the number passed to the helper.

{{sin a}}

returns.description: The sin of the passed number

functions.name: sqrt
functions.description:
Executes Math.sqrt on the number passed to the helper.

{{sqrt a}}

returns.description: The sqrt of the passed number

functions.name: sub
functions.description:
Subtracts two or more numbers

{{sub a b}}

returns.description: The difference of all the passed numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to subtract

functions.name: sum
functions.description:
Alias for {{add}} helper

{{sum a b}}

returns.description: The sum of all the passed numbers

params.name: numbers
params.description: A list of numbers to sum

functions.name: tan
functions.description:
Executes Math.tan on the number passed to the helper.

{{tan a}}

returns.description: The tan of the passed number

functions.name: tanh
functions.description:
Executes Math.tanh on the number passed to the helper.

returns.description: The tanh of the passed number

functions.name: trunc
functions.description:
Executes Math.trunc on the number passed to the helper.

{{trunc a}}

returns.description: The trunc of the passed number

template:docs/configuration.text: Configuration If you don't need all the helpers, you can specify which to whitelist or blacklist using only or except within your ember-cli-build.js: module.exports = function(defaults) { var app = new EmberApp(defaults, { 'ember-math-helpers': { only: ['add', 'sub'], except: ['random', 'tan'] } }); Both only and except can be safely used together (the addon computes the diff), although it's best if you only use one for your own sanity. except: ['random'] // imports all helpers except `random` only: ['random'] // imports only `random`

template:docs/index.title: ember-math-helpers
template:docs/index.text: ember-math-helpers ember-math-helpers is built and maintained by Ship Shape. Contact us for Ember.js consulting, development, and training for your project. HTMLBars template helpers for doing basic arithmetic operations Installation ember install ember-math-helpers

template:docs/playground.title: Playground
template:docs/playground.text: Playground Here are a few interactive examples. Try changing the numbers in the templates and you should see the results update!

template:docs/usage.text: Usage Advanced Arithmetic Greatest Common Divisor The gcd helper uses the Euclidean Algorithm to find the largest positive integer that divides two integers. {{gcd 100 48}} <!-- Computes 4 --> {{gcd 6 -10}} <!-- Computes 2 --> If no arguments are passed, the helper will return 0. If one argument is passed, the helper will simply reflect it back. Least common multiple The lcm helper calculates the smallest positive integer that is divisible by both a and b. {{lcm 15 12}} <!-- Computes 60 --> Special Cases Right now, there is one special case: the round helper will also take either a decimals property or an exp property. decimals will round to the specified number of decimals, while exp will round to the given power of ten. For example: {{round 35.855 decimals=2}} {{!-- prints "35.86" --}} {{round 1234567 exp=3}} {{!-- prints "1235000" --}} Random Helper JavaScript HTMLBars random (No Args) [, decimals] Math.random(), decimals sets precision from 0-20 (default: 0) {{random}} or {{random decimals=4}} random (Upper Bound) [, round] capped Math.random(), decimals sets precision from 0-20 (default: 0) {{random 42}} or {{random 42 decimals=4}} random (Upper Bound, Lower Bound) [, round]) bounded Math.random(), decimals sets precision from 0-20 (default: 0) {{random 21 1797}} or {{random 21 1797 decimals=4}} Composable Helpers There is full support for using all of the helpers together, to do complex math, even though complex calculations may be better left to JS. For something like (15 + 5) / 2 * 10 you could do: {{mult (div (add 15 5) 2) 10}}

template:index.title: Math Helpers
template:index.text: Math Helpers Just a simple addon for doing basic arithmetic operations with Ember and HTMLBars Read the docs
